intro: Pedicularis bella subsp. bella, commonly known as the beautiful lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. This species is characterized by its striking violet or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in alpine or subalpine habitats, often in rocky or open areas. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it a notable species in botanical studies.
